intro: Odontostemma nigricans var. nigricans, commonly known as the black-stemmed arrowroot, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Marantaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy rhizomes that are used as a starch source. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments and has broad, lance-shaped leaves with a smooth texture. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its ornamental value and edible rhizomes, it is cultivated in some tropical gardens and for its nutritional benefits.
